showScoreExcerpt:
a dizzying mix of cheeky, poignant and enraged. The comedy is raw and broad, much of the time almost indistinguishable from sketch comedy,..paired with tragedy, ominous and barbed, often within the same scene…Cooper is more interested in using a series of metaphors to make pointed commentary on the current state of the country — and on Black pain — than in creating a consistent fictional world… What holds it all together is the extraordinary cast.

Read more

keyPhrases.quote: What holds it all together is the extraordinary cast.
